clinical_study.brief_title: Inulin-type Fructans-rich Vegetables, Obesity, Gut Microbiota
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of a Diet Rich in Inulin-type Fructans Combined With Inulin Supplementation on Gut Microbiota Composition and Metabolic Parameters in Obese Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to evaluate the effect of a diet based on ITF-rich vegetables in combination with purified ITF supplementation on weight management, metabolic alteration and gut microbiota composition. Obese patients were treated for 3 months and several parameters were measured before and after the study period.

primary_outcome.description: Relative abundance (%) of bacterial taxa will be assessed by 16S rRNA gene sequencing

arm_group.description: 16 g maltodextrin/day + recipes based on vegetables poor in inulin-type fructans
16 g inulin/day + recipes based on vegetables rich in inulin-type fructans

intervention.description: Patient receive Inulin as dietary supplement (16g/d) in combination with dietary advice to enhance the consumption of inulin-rich vegetables
Patient receive maltodextrin as dietary supplement (16g/d) in combination with dietary advice to enhance the consumption of vegetables poor in inulin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index > 30 kg/m²
- Caucasian
- Presence of at least one of the following comorbidity : prediabetes, diabetes, dyslipidemia, hypertension, steatosis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Psychiatric problems or use of antipsychotic
- Consumption of antibiotics, pro/prebiotics, fibre dietary supplement, or any molecules that modifies the intestinal transit (<6 weeks)
- Pregnancy in progress or planified within 6 months
- Specific dietary practise (vegetarian, vegan,...)
- Specific dietary treatment (<6 weeks) (e.g. high protein diet)
- Type 1 diabetes
- Excessive alcohol consumption (>3 glasses/day)
- Inconclusive acceptability test (regarding the protocol of the intervention and the vegetables used in the protocol)
